Think: The user is looking for exercises targeting the biceps using dumbbells. I will recommend exercises that isolate the biceps and provide clear instructions on how to perform them.

Textual response: Based on your preference for beginner-friendly and easy-to-understand explanations, I recommend the following dumbbell exercises for your biceps:

1. Dumbbell Bicep Curls: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward, and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and repeat for 12-15 reps.
2. Dumbbell Hammer Curls: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing towards your body, and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and repeat for 12-15 reps.

These exercises are great for targeting the biceps and can be modified to suit your fitness level.
